composeWithTemplate.list1: Click on "New Message" button in the Mail tab to compose a new message.
composeWithTemplate.list2: Click on three dots menu and choose the "Insert Template" option, it will show the list of folders in a dialog.
composeWithTemplate.list3: Click on any folder and it will list templates in that folder.
composeWithTemplate.list4: Click on any template and click "Insert" button to insert that template.
composeWithTemplate.list5: In an email, the user can insert as many templates as s/he wishes.
composeWithTemplate.list6: The user can insert the template at any position using the cursor.
composeWithTemplate.title: Composing an email with templates

createTemplate.intro: The user can create a template with all the boiler-plate text and placeholders as follows.
createTemplate.list1: Compose an email as usual. (Click on "New Message" button in the Mail tab)
createTemplate.list2: Add the boiler-plate text as necessary.
createTemplate.list3: We can add placeholders where appropriate using $ sign with a name in curly braces as ${MY_PLACEHOLDER}
createTemplate.list4: Placeholder names are case-sensitive and can use albhabets, numbers, hyphen, underscore, dot and space characters.
createTemplate.title: Creating a new template

notes.list1: Email templates works in HTML mode. Plain text mode not supported.
notes.list2: Templates are saved as nothing but regular emails. In that sense any previously existing email can be used in the Insert dialogue.
notes.title: Notes

saveTemplate.list1: Once the user creates a new template with the above steps, s/he should click on three dots menu and choose "Save as Template" option.
saveTemplate.list2: It will show the list of folders to save the template. User can select any folder and click the Save button.
saveTemplate.list3: Note: User can also save templates in any "Shared Folders" with write permission.
saveTemplate.title: Saving the template
